com.ibm.team.repository.client

Interface IOAuthClientLibrary


  • public interface IOAuthClientLibrary
    A library that helps ease the use of OAuth connections between two team repositories.
    Since:
    0.7

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void authorizeRequestToken(java.lang.String requestToken, boolean approve, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
      Mark the given request token as either approved or not approved.
      java.lang.String authorizeRequestTokenWithVerifier(java.lang.String requestToken, boolean approve, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
      Mark the given request token as either approved or not approved, conditionally returning a unique string suitable for use as an oauth_verifier parameter (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5849, Section 2.2) in subsequent token credential requests for the specified requestToken.
      java.lang.String ensureConsumerIsRegistered(ITeamRepository serviceProviderRepo, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
      Ensures that the repository associated with this library is a registered consumer of the serviceProviderRepo repository.
      java.lang.String getAuthenticationToken(ITeamRepository serviceProviderRepo, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
      Returns an authentication token that the repository associated with this library can use to access the serviceProviderRepo.
      com.ibm.team.repository.common.model.OAuthServiceProviderInfo getServiceProviderInfo()
      Returns the standard OAuth information needed to define a service provider.
      java.lang.String registerConsumer(java.security.PublicKey publicKey, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
      Registers a new consumer with the repository associated with this client library.
      java.lang.String registerConsumer(java.lang.String consumerSecret, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
      Registers a new consumer with the repository associated with this client library.

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthenticationToken

        java.lang.String getAuthenticationToken(ITeamRepository serviceProviderRepo,
                                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                        throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns an authentication token that the repository associated with this library can use to access the serviceProviderRepo. This method will also ensure that the repository associated with this library is a registered consumer of the serviceProviderRepo repository.
        Parameters:
        serviceProviderRepo - the repository that will be used an an OAuth service provider
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null
        Returns:
        an authentication token that can be used for this team repository
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if something goes wrong

      • registerConsumer

        java.lang.String registerConsumer(java.lang.String consumerSecret,
                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
        Registers a new consumer with the repository associated with this client library. The consumer's key will be returned.
        Parameters:
        consumerSecret - the shared secret between the consumer and provider
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null
        Returns:
        the consumer key to be used by the newly registered consumer
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if something goes wrong

      • registerConsumer

        java.lang.String registerConsumer(java.security.PublicKey publicKey,
                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
        Registers a new consumer with the repository associated with this client library. The consumer's key will be returned.
        Parameters:
        publicKey - the public key used by the consumer to sign requests
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null
        Returns:
        the consumer key to be used by the newly registered consumer
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if something goes wrong

      • ensureConsumerIsRegistered

        java.lang.String ensureConsumerIsRegistered(ITeamRepository serviceProviderRepo,
                                          org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                            throws TeamRepositoryException
        Ensures that the repository associated with this library is a registered consumer of the serviceProviderRepo repository. This method will either return an existing consumer key or will register a new one if needed.
        Parameters:
        serviceProviderRepo - the service provider that this team repository will access
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null
        Returns:
        the consumer key that should be used when accessing serviceProviderRepo
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if something goes wrong

      • getServiceProviderInfo

        com.ibm.team.repository.common.model.OAuthServiceProviderInfo getServiceProviderInfo()
                                                                                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns the standard OAuth information needed to define a service provider.
        Returns:
        the information needed to define an OAuth service provider.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if something goes wrong

      • authorizeRequestToken

        void authorizeRequestToken(java.lang.String requestToken,
                         boolean approve,
                         org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                           throws TeamRepositoryException
        Mark the given request token as either approved or not approved.
        Parameters:
        requestToken - the request token that needs approval
        approve - whether or not to approve the token
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if something goes wrong

      • authorizeRequestTokenWithVerifier

        java.lang.String authorizeRequestTokenWithVerifier(java.lang.String requestToken,
                                                 boolean approve,
                                                 org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
        Mark the given request token as either approved or not approved, conditionally returning a unique string suitable for use as an oauth_verifier parameter (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5849, Section 2.2) in subsequent token credential requests for the specified requestToken.
        Parameters:
        requestToken - the request token that needs approval
        approve - whether or not to approve the token
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null
        Returns:
        Returns a unique verification string to be returned in subsequent OAuth 1.0a token credential requests. Will be null if approve is set to false.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if something goes wrong
        Since:
        3.0.1.1
